page.title: 18The Huntsman Public House
page.content: There are three public houses in Fryerning, but the only one in our area is The Huntsman. The building there at the moment is about one hundred years old and has a well at the back. The inn used to be The Maypole, probably because it overlooks the village Green, where an annual fair was held. It was later called The Woolpack, but was renamed The Huntsman about eight years ago. Mrs.White told us that the inn used to be owned by Charrington's, but is now a Free House, which means that they can sell beers from different breweries. There is no restaurant, but snack meals can be ordered from the bar at lunchtimes and in the early evening.
